snippet: Life in the 13th Congressional District has not changed drastically since last week’s disputed primary election, which was won by Representative Charles B. Rangel.
abstract: New York City Board of Elections defends its handling of the primary election contest between Rep Charles B Rangel and his main challenger, State Senator Adriano Espaillat; board officials say that Rangel's margin of victory, which has been reduced to 802 votes, was revised so drastically in the days after the election because of unavoidable errors made by poll workers.

byline.original: By KIA GREGORY and KATE TAYLOR

lead_paragraph: Life in the 13th Congressional District has not changed drastically since last week’s disputed primary election, which was won by Representative Charles B. Rangel.

headline.seo: Calm in Charles Rangel’s District Despite Vote Count Drama
headline.main: Amid Vote-Count Drama, Calm in Rangel’s District
headline.print_headline: Amid Vote-Count Drama, Calm in Rangel’s District
